A man can spread ZikaV to his sexual partners. It is unknown yet whether women can transmit the virus. Moreover, the virus is present in semen longer than blood, stressing the importance of condom use and other such means that prevent the unnecessary transmittal of the ZikaV [ 30]. In addition, the issue of viral reservoirs continues as has been found with HIV infection.
Blood Transfusions
Public health services are considering the risk of transmission of ZikaV during blood transfusions. Although no confirmed cases have occurred, reports have indicated potential cases in Brazil and historical records indicated that blood donors have tested positive for the virus after they had given blood [ 30]. Several news sources have reported that donated blood has tested positive for the presence of ZikaV [ 31]
ZikaV vaccines are on the way from NIH and Walter Reed [ 30].
